pullRequest.title: Add config for orc compression codec
pullRequest.bodyText:
Adding a configuration to handle compression codec for handling orc and dwrf storage format. Use hive.orc_compression_codec to override the generic compression codec for orc and dwrf storage format. The reason to add an extra configuration was the unavailability of uniform support of all compression codec across all storage formats. The ZSTD compression codec is only available for orc and dwrf storage format.
== RELEASE NOTES ==

Hive Changes
--------------
Add configuration property `hive.orc-compression-codec` to override `hive.compression-codec` for ORC and DWRF formats. If specified, ORC and DWRF files are compressed using this codec. RC, Parquet, and other files are compressed using `hive.compression-codec`.

beforeCommit.message:
Add config for orc compression codec

Adding a configuration to handle compression codec for handling orc
and dwrf storage format. Use hive.orc_compression_codec to override
the generic compression codec for orc and dwrf storage format. The
reason to add an extra configuration was the unavailability of uniform
support of all compression codec across all storage formats. The ZSTD
compression codec is only available for orc and dwrf storage format.

nodes.bodyText: What other storage format cannot have zstd?

nodes.bodyText: I'm curious, why do we still set the default codec to be gzip for orc? As I saw from the note, ZSTD is better than GZIP in both compression ratio and CPU.

nodes.bodyText: nit: drop @return actualStorageFormat - it doesn't add any information
nit: perhaps,  shorten to Use  {@link #getActualStorageFormat()}; @deprecated annotation already says "This field is deprecated"
nit: perhaps, shorten to Use {@link #getActualStorageFormat()}; @deprecated annotation already says "This field is deprecated"

For the purpose of checking compatibility between StorageFormat and HiveCompressionCodec, you can use HiveCompressionCodec::isSupportedStorageFormat


For the purpose of getting ORC specific compression method,  you can use HiveCompressionCodec::orcCompressionKind


I didn't quite understand why existing hive.compression-codec is not good enough.
